column4: I have a 28" viewsonic screen running at 1920x1200, and an nvidia 9800GT - all runs fine. Vista needed the latest nvidia driver to support this monitor
When I enable restricted drivers, two things happen
the gamma gets knocked out, and the screen is very dark
the second thing is the same as what happened on vista, the screen is zoomed... it gets the right reslution but dirplsyas it nicorewnt
that was meant to say 'but it displays it incorrectly
not only has the manufacturer *(*$($ up a keyboard I used to buy, and made it spongy (same model, now spongy and unusable) but this nvidia thing is nanoying
Why is ubuntu showing a google custom search?
that is completely broken, why would one OS have a different google? how pointless is that - is it a money thing? (I realise it is a default)

spectacular deduction. What helped you? The part where I said 'obviously' previously, or  your immense intellect. Now, since the argument isn't about whether you can change it, why would that even enter into the conversation?
-- Don't cry over a spilled milk.
no I am crying over my 28" monitor having some issue with nvidia card and taking resolution but 'zooming' it
-- I'm only here for social // to help people if I can -- Check your resolution -- Is it same resolution as you expected it would be for your said monitor?
and the issue isn't me whining about the custom search, it is just a direct criticism with reasoning, I don't care either way, but it will annoy users
no everything is ok, as I said
